info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 5:58PM EDT until July 16 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Fauquier County in northern Virginia... Central Culpeper County in northern Virginia... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 558 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Culpeper, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...65 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Culpeper, Bealeton, Opal, Remington, Midland, Elkwood, Catalpa, Stevensburg, Brandy Station, Lois, Winston, Lignum, Morrisville, Alanthus, Goldvein and Sumerduck. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
